What are some of the significant problems that Verus has solved in the blockchain space?

Verus has solved several critical problems in the blockchain space, including the "nothing at stake" problem, weak subjectivity, and 51% hash attacks. These solutions have been implemented on the Verus blockchain and are also applicable to other blockchains built on the Verus system.

ths of my own personal involvement with the project I’ve witnessed the most impressive development and strides I’ve ever seen a blockchain project take with such finesse, speed and accuracy. I’m so excited and grateful to be a part of this community and this vision.
Solving the Biggest Problems in Blockchain
In just 8 months Verus solved the theoretical problem of “nothing at stake” through a solution that incorporates decentralization and incentivizes fair play while making it an economically losing proposition to try cheating at Proof of Stake and technically improbable/unlikely. Verus then went on to solve the problem of weak subjectivity while developing a new consensus algorithm called Proof of Power. Proof of Power is immune to 51% hash attacks as proven in the mathematical paper which Verus developers released shortly after releasing the consensus mechanism to the Verus blockchain.
For anyone who isn’t so tech savvy, these three issues (Nothing at Stake on a PoS consensus, Weak Subjectivity, and 51% Hash Attacks) are arguably the top three biggest threats which face blockchain technology…and all three have been solved in a matter of months on the Verus blockchain and, in turn, for all blockchains stood up on the Verus system as autochains. Not only did Verus solve these, they have proven the 51% hash attack solution mathematically and implemented it in practice in forks and upgrades that are now live as the current Verus blockchain today.
Another major event last year, Verus incorporated the Zcash Sapling upgrade, the largest upgrade to the Zcash code yet, equipping Verus with lightning fast and resource light zk-SNARK transactions. This was a massive upgrade and positioned the Verus blockchain further in terms of the goals of Public Blockchain as a Service. As a part of this upgrade Verus also incorporated smart contracts through an enhanced implementation of

What is Proof of Power, and how does it address the problem of 51% hash attacks?

Proof of Power is a consensus algorithm developed by Verus, which is immune to 51% hash attacks. This algorithm has been mathematically proven and implemented on the Verus blockchain, ensuring that the network is secure against such attacks.

What was the significance of Verus incorporating the Zcash Sapling upgrade?

The incorporation of the Zcash Sapling upgrade equipped Verus with lightning-fast and resource-light zk-SNARK transactions, positioning the Verus blockchain further towards its goal of Public Blockchain as a Service. Additionally, this upgrade enabled smart contracts through an enhanced implementation of the zk-SNARK protocol.
